newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Rouble eases despite shortage for T-bill sale.
newsitem.headline: Rouble eases despite shortage for T-bill sale.

text.p: The rouble eased in lively trading on Wednesday despite an early rouble shortage which caused it to firm initially as banks swept up funds for today's T-bills sales, dealers said.
The central bank is auctioning today 7.5 trillion roubles of one-year paper and 4.5 trillion roubles of three-month bills.
roubles/dollar Feb 26 midday Feb 26 early Feb 25 close
Today roubles started at 5,670-72 but firmed to 5,668-69 in early trade as overnight funds rose over 50 percent.
"(Today dollars) were falling for some time as roubles are scarce due to the auctions," one dealer said.
Another dealer said banks which were short of roubles had sold dollars, pushing up rouble overnight rates as high as 60 percent.
